image.altText: A man with beard smiling in a laboratory with measuring instruments on a table

props.synopsis: They're called '"forever chemicals" because of their extreme durability, but Adelaide researchers say they have developed a new method to combat PFAS.

title.children: Researchers develop new material to help combat 'forever chemicals'

image.altText: A close up image of an SA Police car.

props.synopsis: SA Police and emergency services are at the scene of a light plane crash at Yeelanna, north of Cummins, on the Eyre Peninsula.

title.children: Emergency services responding to light plane crash on Eyre Peninsula

image.altText: A police security office in a navy uniform walks down a road to a large school building

props.synopsis: An 18-year-old was charged in May over alleged threats to use explosives and poisons to target a school and public events in Adelaide.

title.children: Charges dropped against teen accused of threatening staff and students at Adelaide high school

image.altText: Sheep having a feed. Drone photo taken from above.

props.synopsis: The nation's drought supports will come under scrutiny at a major national forum today as southern farmers continue to battle dry times.

title.children: Calls to review drought policy to better help struggling farmers

image.altText: a young man in blue and yellow american football gear in a professional photo

props.synopsis: Growing up in South Australia's Riverland, Jake Stoeckel never imagined one day he would be playing college football for the Kent State Golden Flashes in the United States.

title.children: Player 'with natural kick' switches from Aussie Rules to American football

image.altText: A mother smiling and hugging a young boy in Crows top holding a football next to seats at an oval

props.synopsis: AFL barracking is again in the spotlight after the recent booing of a player who was the victim of a slur. Confronted by some of the language they recently heard at a match, footy fans Angela and Archie came up with a "light way to get around a bit of a serious topic".

title.children: Amid booing, sledges and slurs, AFL fans resort to 'swearing spotto'

image.altText: A large auditorium with rows of chairs facing three PowerPoint screens

props.synopsis: Türkiye rejects Australia's bid to host the COP31 climate summit in Adelaide.

title.children: Australia and Türkiye fight to host COP31 climate summit

image.altText: man in bush hat and pink shirt holds up his 4 year old son in stripped shirt

props.synopsis: In outback NSW, fourth-generation farmer Sam Beven is forging the way for the next generation of farming families.

title.children: Young dad takes over sheep station 'bigger than Singapore' to keep legacy

image.altText: Woman with dark hair smiles with mouth closed

props.synopsis: When Louisa Ioannidis was found dead in a creek, police found no suspicious circumstances. But Louisa's brother had his doubts, and now a legal team has found compelling new evidence that the case should be reopened.

title.children: Dead in her dressing gown, the shocking events before Louisa's creek death

image.altText: Green leader Adam Bandt speaking at a press conference.

props.synopsis: The Australian Conservation Foundation (ACF) has appointed former Greens leader Adam Bandt as the organisation's next chief executive. Follow live.

title.children: Ex-Greens leader Bandt to lead Australian Conservation Foundation

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Adam Bandt takes up new role as Australian Conservation Foundation chief
Alex Hawke asks Jacinta Nampijinpa Price to apologise for Indian migration comments
New protections for travellers in government sights

image.altText: A composite image of a bright red and white sign that says 'coles' and a white sign that says 'woolworths' with a green icon.

props.synopsis: The ASX has ended in the red after Wall Street's retreat on Friday. The major supermarket chains expect to pay hundreds of millions more to remediate underpaid staff. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX ends in the red as energy and banks drag

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Supermarkets' $1.6 billion staff repayments 'manageable': J.P. Morgan
Aviation protections welcome but fall short: Choice

image.altText: A WA police officer stands with his back to the camera looking at two trucks

props.synopsis: A WA judge finds police acted unlawfully in detaining a man in July 2023, leading to him being allowed to go free despite being found to be in possession of methylamphetamine.

title.children: Botched police search lets man found with packages of drugs walk free

image.altText: A man with a bandaged arm sits in front a tent across from a boy

props.synopsis: Hundreds of thousands of Palestinians are being told to immediately leave Gaza City, as the Israeli military's campaign to take over and occupy the area intensifies by the hour.

title.children: Palestinians in Gaza City consider evacuating for their children's sake

image.altText: Anti-immigration rally Canberra

props.synopsis: Australia's Neo-Nazis sought to make their own message out of anti-immigration marches, and they succeeded.

title.children: Australia's Neo-Nazis have had an unadulterated propaganda win

image.altText: Man in blue suit jacket with black Labrador dog

props.synopsis: A vision-impaired Paralympic swimmer says he had to involve police when three different Uber drivers refused him transport because he had his guide dog with him.

title.children: Police called after Uber drivers refused service to Paralympian with guide dog

image.altText: A young man wearing a puffer jacket smiles while holding a red shoe.

props.synopsis: A 15-year-old boy killed as he made his way home from playing basketball is being mourned as police investigate the fatal stabbing of two children in Melbourne's outer-west on Saturday night.

title.children: 'Beautiful' young man among pair mourned after fatal Melbourne attacks

image.altText: Carlos Alcaraz kisses a trophy

props.synopsis: Carlos Alcaraz wins the men's US Open, reclaiming his world number one ranking by defeating Jannik Sinner.

title.children: Alcaraz wins US Open over Sinner, reclaims world number one ranking

image.altText: A woman standing in a warehouse with hi-vi jacket

props.synopsis: Cosmetics entrepreneurs through to tech developers say Austrade's signature export grant has become unfair, badly managed and opaque, all while many are struggling to adjust to Donald Trump's US tariffs.

title.children: Austrade outrage as exporters detail 'disaster' grants process

image.altText: Close up image of a red race car driving on the highway in the Czech Republic

props.synopsis: The driver, a 51-year-old man, had been spotted on the highways near Prague numerous times over the past six years.

title.children: Czech police arrest man for driving racing car on the highway

image.altText: In a large black dress lady gaga accepts her award and speaks

props.synopsis: Ariana Grande and Lady Gaga took home the biggest awards at this year's MTV VMAs with several nineties stars honoured for their musical legacy.

title.children: Key moments from the 2025 MTV Video Music Awards

image.altText: Woman in black blazer and green shirt stands against white wall

props.synopsis: There is open despair inside the Liberal Party about how to rebuild its standing in multicultural communities after Jacinta Nampijinpa Price's inflammatory comments about Indian migrants.

title.children: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price saga shows challenge ahead for Liberals

image.altText: China Sols GIFTS

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese begins a long Pacific tour this week ahead of the Pacific Islands Forum meeting in Solomon Islands, as the battle for influence between China and Australia continues to create headlines.

title.children: Pacific leaders to meet amid flurry of 'comical' gift-giving

image.altText: A remote control is held in a person's hand above a table.

props.synopsis: Whether it is an 80s classic or a Disney favourite, many of us watch old TV shows and films when we crave comfort, but there is a downside.

title.children: Comfort viewing 'feels good' but it can have 'a dark side'

image.altText: Protest at Bondi video

props.synopsis: Chris Minns has condemned the scenes of protesters clashing at Bondi Beach on Sunday as police look into if anyone involved should face charges.

title.children: Premier condemns 'reprehensible' Bondi protests clash as police investigate

image.altText: Jeromey Webberley

props.synopsis: Former Richmond player Jeromey Webberley will coach the Tasmania Devil men's side as it enters its first season with the Victorian Football League.

title.children: Ex-Tiger announced as coach of Tasmania Devils in VFL competition

image.altText: Four anonymous silhouettes in front of a court building which reads 'Family Court of Australia'.

props.synopsis: From lawyers "maximising fees" to a family report writer's warning that "your case is a murder-suicide waiting to happen", these parents share allegations of their experience in the Family Court of Australia.

title.children: 'Crushing': Parents desperate for changes to family law system

image.altText: A dolphin in action through the waves.

props.synopsis: Data shows in the first six months of this year, four dolphins died from becoming entangled in salmon farm enclosures in Tasmania's southern waters.

title.children: Four dolphins die after entanglement in Huon Aquaculture salmon pens

image.altText: Rob Wignalls leans against his home behind warning tape.

props.synopsis: A long-time winemaker says he opened his door to explosions and a black ball of smoke as a fire caused by a cordless screwdriver destroyed a lifetime collection of tools and machinery.

title.children: Winemaker shares devastation after lithium battery fire guts warehouse

image.altText: Vanessa Mbeve on holiday in Fiji

props.synopsis: For sometimes up to 12 hours a day, I was falling prey to rage bait and the comparison trap. I wondered what it would be like to live without that noise.

title.children: What I learnt from three months of drastically reducing my screen time

image.altText: A child playing with colourful toys.

props.synopsis: Authorities are investigating after two reports were made to police last week.

title.children: Childcare worker under investigation for alleged physical violence

image.altText: A woman, wearing a snorkel and mask under water, next to a massive marlin.

props.synopsis: After a shock cancer diagnosis, Nikki Watt thought she'd never dive again. But now she's broken a spearfishing world record with a huge marlin.

title.children: The Australian woman who spearfished a 162.5kg striped marlin

image.altText: A close up of a red and pink moon against a black sky

props.synopsis: Stargazers around the world are dazzled by the sight of a "blood moon" — or total lunar eclipse — with the spectacular sight even visible from Australia.

title.children: Blood moon delights stargazers as total lunar eclipse seen from Australia

image.altText: Nurses and supporting trade unionists rally outside Parliament House in Melbourne.

props.synopsis: For the first time in 36 years Victorian nurses' union members will vote on a new branch secretary after a failed pay deal led to the resignation of the former boss.

title.children: Turmoil in powerful nurses union as members vote on Victorian branch boss

image.altText: Mercury Psillakis takes a selfie of him and his brother who is holding a surfboard

props.synopsis: A childhood friend has described the "heroic" final act of a surfer who steered his friends to safety before being mauled by a shark at Sydney's Northern Beaches on Saturday.

title.children: Friend describes 'heroic' final act of Sydney surfer killed in shark attack
